title: Firefox e o CSP - Content-Security-Header
content:
Olá,

Há pouco tempo passei a usar as 'Security Headers' configuradas no .htaccess. Só houve um problema com a CSP - Content-Security-Policy, pois o Firefox desconfigura o site, que tem um Iframe. Os outros Browsers mais conhecidos navegam bem.

Já desabilitei todas as extensões e temas desses navegadores.

Estou usando a CSP dessa forma: Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; img-src 'self'; style-src 'self';base-uri 'self'; form-action 'self'"

Já tirei um por um até ficar assim: Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'"

Mas o problema continua no Firefox. Alguma sugestão?

Apenas como informação:

Aparência do site normal, usando o Firefox (sem o CSP):

Aparência do site desconfigurado, usando o Firefox (com o CSP):
creator: Jeff123

title: installation keeps stopping
content: trying to download Firefox app for my MacBook Air running Monterey 12.7.6 download keeps stopping and displays error message that I cannot read in it's entirety
creator: 5nwnr9gp67

title: All Sync Data Was Removed Upon Password Reset
content:
I submitted this as a bug report but I will also submit this here to see if anyone has any information or a solution.

After resetting my password, none of my sync data from before the install is there. Only the sync data from my laptop, but even on my laptop it no longer lists my old computer, it is as if my PC from before the new OS has simply been deleted from the sync logs. In fact, my sync logs only go back to the moment I changed my password. I am not sure how to proceed as it appears that there aren't even any traces of my sync from before this point.

It would be nice if I could get the old tabs I had open on my desktop before I changed my OS, but it's not exactly a "world ending" situation.
creator: liam.m.connorb

title: Can't edit extension settings
content: In other browsers when I add extensions, I can open an extension panel, or got the the browsers installed extensions section, and edit open up my extension setting pages, and edit them. For example uBlock Origin, but there are others. It doesn't seem possible to do such a thing with Firefox. Is that on purpose or is something wrong?
creator: sollazzo_15

title: New Tabs
content: The 130 update changed my new tab to open in Firefox by default how do I put it back to open new tabs in Google.com; the same as my home page?
creator: dpki8p

title: Getting the old "Your browser does not support High-Definition" on Amazon Prime Video, on FF MacOS
content:
It started doing this last week. I had this happening a couple versions ago but it went away by itself (I think).

Clearing cache won't help, not restarting it in Troubleshoot mode, etc.

Firefox is up-to-date and this was fixed a couple versions ago.

New bug?
